title: What secrets have you kept since high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: It wasn’t just a secret since high school, it was a secret throughout all of my school years, and for many years after that. I was born in 1954. I realized I was attracted to my own gender when I was 6, in 1960. I would fully understand why I was the way I was when I was 13/14 in 1968. I realized I was gay. This was hard to do anything about it, because being gay at that time was illegal and considered to be a mental illness and could get you institutionalized or incarcerated, or dead. I did meet and fall in love with a boy when I was 14 to 16 (1968–1970), but it had to be kept hidden. I would be discovered to be gay when I was 16 (in 1970) and my adopted mother damn near beat me to death. I was threatened by her to never tell. So, I buried it. I would never admit it. I had to “play the part” of being straight. Only one thing, I never expected to meet and marry the only woman who would love me for me. My wife died in 2015. I openly came out as gay afterward, which was my promise to her. She knew why I buried being me, and she knew my adopted mother would have destroyed me if I had come out. I openly came out on March 3, 2015. OMG, did that open a flood gate? I was in touch with several of my classmates on Facebook. When I openly came out to them, their response was, “Tell us something we didn’t already know.” WTF???? They all said they had figured it out a long time ago. It didn’t matter to them, they still considered me to be their friend and loved me just the same. That is the secret I carried from high school.

Back in high school, I had a party when my parents were out. When cleaning up, we had a sixer leftover. We had to ditch it. We put it up in the rafters. Later, my dad found it. He drilled both me and my brother and, to this day, we have never come clean. They still ask from time to time.
